Crudeulos

From Peragro Tempus Wiki

Crudeulos

The Crudeulos is a large omnivorous creature. For its size it is incredibly fast, able to outrun even the fastest men. Its skin is a distinctly diffuse grey matching the rock of the area. In some of the midland plains in the tall grass from which rocks frequently protrude, the Crudeulos is actually very difficult to spot as it simply resembles one of the many large rocks. Hunting them is a popular past time for those that can afford the coordinated hunt and expensive weapons needed to bring down one of these large beasts. Displaying the hide of one of these creatures is considered a status symbol among many of the Great Houses.

Physical Traits:

  • Height: 3 Meters
  • Girth: 1.5 meters
  • Legnth: 7 meters
  • Weight: 2800 Kilograms

Locomotion: They generally run and walk on all fours, able to gallop at incredible speeds. While they are occasionally seen grazing, they are also aggressive hunters, and are able to rear up on two legs and slice at their prey with the claws on their front legs.

General Appearance: Crudeulos are grey with very rough leathery skin. Their heads are large considering in proportion to their body, with 3 pairs of large teeth protruding from their lower jaw upwards on the outside of their lips such that they are always visible. The back pair are longer and curve outwards and down away from the head. They have no tail at all and are very rounded near the rear end with the exception of some gnarly stone-like bumps blotting randomly over their skin.
